entry.title: OpenLayers Select and Highlight Feature Example
entry.tags: select, highlight, hover, onmouseover, click, vector
entry.summary: Select features on click, highlight features on hover.

entry.title: StyleMap Example
entry.summary: Shows how to use a StyleMap to style features with rule based styling. A style map references one or more OpenLayers.Style objects. These OpenLayers.Style objects are collections of OpenLayers.Rule objects that determine how features are styled. An OpenLayers.Rule object combines an OpenLayers.Filter object with a symbolizer. A filter is used to determine whether a rule applies for a given feature, and a symbolizer is used to draw the feature if the rule applies.

entry.title: Paging Strategy Example
entry.tags: vector, feature, stylemap, paging, strategy, flickr, script
entry.summary: Uses a paging strategy to cache large batches of features and render a page at a time.

entry.title: Graticule Example
entry.tags: graticule, grid, projection, proj4js, reproject, transform
entry.summary: Adds a Graticule control to the map to display a grid of latitude and longitude.

entry.title: Using Proj4JS for vector reprojection
entry.tags: projection, proj, proj4js, reprojection, reproject, transform, transformation, epsg, srs
entry.summary: This example shows how to reproject vector features within OpenLayers. The baselayer shows Germany in the projection EPSG:31467 (GK 3). When one clicks on the buttons, features with geometries originally in EPSG:4326 will be transformed to the projection of the map on-the-fly.

entry.summary: Shows how to use MapBox tiles in an OpenLayers map.

entry.summary: Uses a BBOX strategy to request features within a bounding box.

entry.summary: Demonstrates how, with a custom read method, the script protocol and GeoJSON format can be used to read features stored in a table on Google Fusion Tables.

entry.title: Feature Styles Example
entry.summary: To style features with a custom function that evaluates each feature, use the context option of an OpenLayers.Style object. If the context object contains a function and this function is referenced in a symbolizer, the function will be called with the feature as an argument..
